intro: Chuquiraga orbignyana, commonly known as the Andean bur plant, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are often surrounded by bracts, and it is known for its fibrous, woody stems. Its leaves are typically alternate, simple, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Chuquiraga orbignyana is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or arid habitats.
